original: Meurling, Erik, kontraktsprost, Kristdala, f. 15/8/79 i Kristdala, Kalmar 1., av kontraktsprosten Cha-rodotes M. och Ellen (grönlund. G. 06 m. Marianne Wågman. Barn: Per f. 06, Mårten 08, Odov 09 (d. 36), Cha-rodotes 12 (d. 12), Gertrud 14, Carl 16, Christer 18 (d. 23). — Mog:ex. i Linköp. 97, jur. fil. ex. i Upps. 98, fil. kand. 00, teor. samt prakt. teol. ex. 03, prov-år 04, teol. lic. 17. Extralär. v. Upps. h. a. 1. 05, adj. där 09, ilär. v. Upps. elem:lärov. f. fl. 06-20, regipastor v. Uppl. inf :reg. 12-20, kyrkoh. i Hällestad 20, i Kristdala sed. 24 (i oavbr. följd den tionde av ’släkten -sed. 1582 o._ den sjätte son efter fader sed. 1708), kontr iproist i Tunaläns o. Sevede kontr. sed. 38, fördeln |pastor 40. Led. av Allm. sv. prästfören. centralistyr. 30-47. av Linköp. domkap. 37-46, av kyrkomöt. 38 o. 41, insp. f. Oskarshamns realsk. 33-37, Vimmerby realsk. sed. 38, var i Upp’s. bl. a. iled. av stads-fullm., komm. uppdrag i KrLstdala. Red. av Sv. Kyrkotidn. 10-20 o. 21-22, forts. utg. av Linköp. stifts herdaminne, börjat utg. Kristdala s :ns hist., publ. ett Stort antal art. i tidh. o. tid-skr. i kyrkl ämnen, skolfrågor m.m.
translated: Meurling, Erik, archdeacon, Kristdala, b. 15/8/79 in Kristdala, Kalmar 1st district, son of archdeacon Cha-rodotes M. and Ellen (Grönlund). Married in 1906 to Marianne Wågman. Children: Per b. 1906, Mårten b. 1908, Odov b. 1909 (d. 1936), Cha-rodotes b. 1912 (d. 1912), Gertrud b. 1914, Carl b. 1916, Christer b. 1918 (d. 1923). — Examined in Law at Linköping University in 1897, Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1898, Bachelor of Philosophy in 1900, theological theory and practical exams in 1903, probation year in 1904, Licentiate of Theology in 1917. Extraordinary teacher at Uppsala University from 1905, adjunct there in 1909, teacher at Uppsala elementary school from 1906-1920, royal pastor at Upplands regiment from 1912-1920, parish priest in Hällestad from 1920, in Kristdala since 1924 (the tenth in an unbroken line of the family since 1582 and the sixth son following his father since 1708), archdeacon in Tunaläns and Sevede districts since 1938, distributed pastor from 1940. Member of the General Swedish Clergy Association's central board from 1930-1947, member of the Linköping Cathedral chapter from 1937-1946, member of the Church Assembly in 1938 and 1941, inspector of Oskarshamn high school from 1933-1937, Vimmerby high school since 1938, held various positions in Uppsala such as member of the city council, commission assignments in Kristdala. Editor of the Swedish Church Newspaper from 1910-1920 and 1921-1922, continues to publish the Linköping diocese's clergy memoirs, started publishing Kristdala's local history, published a large number of articles in newspapers and magazines on church matters, school issues, etc.

structured.name: Erik Meurling
structured.description: Archdeacon Erik Meurling was born on August 15, 1879, in Kristdala, Kalmar, Sweden. He was the son of archdeacon Cha-rodotes M. and Ellen (Grönlund). Erik married Marianne Wågman in 1906, and they had several children together. Erik studied law at Linköping University and earned a Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Philosophy from Uppsala University. He also completed theological exams and became a Licentiate of Theology. Erik worked as an archdeacon, extraordinary teacher, and adjunct at Uppsala University. He was a member of various organizations, including the General Swedish Clergy Association, Linköping Cathedral Chapter, and Church Assembly. Erik had positions in Uppsala, such as a member of the city council and commission assignments in Kristdala. He published articles on church matters, school issues, and more. More information about Erik Meurling can be found at the provided URL.
